content: The Drawn Sword of God
The word of the  came to me:
Mortal, set your face toward Jerusalem and preach against the sanctuaries; prophesy against the land of Israel
and say to the land of Israel, Thus says the : I am coming against you, and will draw my sword out of its sheath, and will cut off from you both righteous and wicked.
Because I will cut off from you both righteous and wicked, therefore my sword shall go out of its sheath against all flesh from south to north;
and all flesh shall know that I the  have drawn my sword out of its sheath; it shall not be sheathed again.
Moan therefore, mortal; moan with breaking heart and bitter grief before their eyes.

And when they say to you, “Why do you moan?” you shall say, “Because of the news that has come. Every heart will melt and all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint and all knees will turn to water. See, it comes and it will be fulfilled,” says the Lord .
And the word of the  came to me:
Mortal, prophesy and say: Thus says the Lord; Say:
A sword, a sword is sharpened,
it is sharpened for slaughter,
How can we make merry?
The sword is given to be polished,
it is sharpened, the sword is polished,
Cry and wail, O mortal,
it is against all Israel’s princes;
For consider: What! If you despise the rod, will it not happen? says the Lord .
And you, mortal, prophesy;
Let the sword fall twice, thrice;
A sword for great slaughter—
therefore hearts melt
At all their gates I have set
Ah! It is made for flashing,
Attack to the right!
I too will strike hand to hand,
The word of the  came to me:
Mortal, mark out two roads for the sword of the king of Babylon to come; both of them shall issue from the same land. And make a signpost, make it for a fork in the road leading to a city;
mark out the road for the sword to come to Rabbah of the Ammonites or to Judah and to Jerusalem the fortified.
For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the way, at the fork in the two roads, to use divination; he shakes the arrows, he consults the teraphim, he inspects the liver.

Into his right hand comes the lot for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to call out for slaughter, for raising the battle cry, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up ramps, to build siege towers.
But to them it will seem like a false divination; they have sworn solemn oaths; but he brings their guilt to remembrance, bringing about their capture.

Therefore thus says the Lord : Because you have brought your guilt to remembrance, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your deeds your sins appear—because you have come to remembrance, you shall be taken in hand.
As for you, vile, wicked prince of Israel,
thus says the Lord :
Remove the turban, take off the crown;
Exalt that which is low,
A ruin, a ruin, a ruin—
Until he comes whose right it is;
As for you, mortal, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord  concerning the Ammonites, and concerning their reproach; say:
A sword, a sword! Drawn for slaughter,
Offering false visions for you,
they place you over the necks
those whose day has come,
Return it to its sheath!
In the place where you were created,
I will pour out my indignation upon you,
I will deliver you into brutish hands,
You shall be fuel for the fire,
you shall be remembered no more,
